prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please cite unpublished materials in the following way:
Please provide the title and date of item, catalog number (if applicable it will be found written on the folder), name of the collection, name of the repository, and location of the repository.

Example: James Oglethorpe to the Trustees, 13 January 1876, RG0001 Series 1, Box 4, Folder 3. Records of the Board of Trustees, Special Collections Research Center, Gelman Library, The George Washington University, Washington, D.C.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains reports related to aspects of safety within the Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority system. These reports date from 1982-1985. Some are lightly annotated. Several were produced by the De Leuw, Cather & Company Engineers and Planners.

archdesc.bioghist: Biographical / Historical Richard Bolt worked on design and building of the early years of Metrorail. He was a Senior System Safety Engineer with De Leuw, Cather &s; Company and served as the System Safety and Reliability Engineer on several WMATA projects as a contractor with Ralph M Parsons. While working at NASA as an engineer he worked on historically significant projects including the Apollo Moon Landing Life Support Backpack that were used on first moon landings.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Both copies of the report titled Life Safety forest glen station section B009, 1982 October were retained because each copy had different annotations.
